text: [Music]
I I really can't speak broadly on and I
don't don't mean to disappoint you but
I'm part of the reason why I don't
follow their positions in detail there
are two reasons um one is I know that on
most of the issues most of them are not
good and I just can't remember I mean
the candidates that have been
affirmatively good on civil liberties
are always very obscure candidates I
would say you know on the whole Dennis
cinic and Ron Paul have on the whole
been the best on the most civil
liberties and I sort of have come to
take for granted that mainstream
candidates who are seeking their party's
endorsement or the national vote H feel
that they have to capitulate overall on
civil liberties issues I mean the last
Democratic president we had and I
constantly amazed that uh he is always
bashed as is his wife uh for being so
liberal when to me they were I mean and
and liberal has been equated with ACLU
inaccurately but that goes back to at
least George Bush against Michael Duke
cacus um you know that Clinton even
during this phase of his candidacy that
Hillary is now going through do you
remember how he well you were too young
but some in the audience might remember
that um he left New Hampshire during
high primary campaign season to fly back
to Arkansas where he was governor to
preside over the execution of a mentally
prisoner um and and that spoke
volumes and then by the way before 911
the worst terrorist attack on us soil
was the 1995 Oklahoma City Bombing and
Clinton and his attorney general reacted
exactly the same way Bush and his
attorney general reacted after 911 they
passed pushed through Congress something
that was called the 1996 anti-terrorism
and effective death penalty act so I'm
sorry if I sound a little bit cynical I
just don't have very high hopes about
anybody who's running for president on
the issues of it used to be the war on
crime now and it's still the war on
drugs and now it's the war on terror uh
and the second reason why you know the
the you know so some are a little bit
less bad on some issues and some are a
little bit less good on some issues you
know McCain would be horrible for uh
reproductive freedom for example I don't
think he would be good for Supreme Court
appointments which by the way that is my
single most important issue when I look
at a presidential candidate because I
you know but before I I get to that
speaking of the three branches of
government the other reason why I'm
somewhat less focused on the president
than a lot of my friends are is because
I have this sense that there's a lot of
damage that's been done that can only be
undone by Congress and it doesn't really
matter who the president is if Congress
doesn't have the will to repeal some of
the terrible legislation or to pass some
positive
[Music]
legislation
